intro: Conioselinum bipinnatum, commonly known as the double-pinnate wormwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. Conioselinum bipinnatum is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is often used in traditional herbal medicine.
